meanings.definition: To convert or attempt to convert someone from one religion, belief, or opinion to another.
meanings.sent1: She was proselyting her friend to join her book club.
meanings.sent2: The missionaries were proselyting in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The cat was proselyting the dog to prefer fish over meat.
meanings.sent4: His persuasive arguments were proselyting even the most stubborn minds.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's enthusiasm for science was proselyting the students to love the subject.

meanings.definition: The act of attempting to convert someone from one religion, belief, or opinion to another.
meanings.sent1: The proselyting of new members was successful for the church.
meanings.sent2: He dedicated his life to proselyting for his cause.
meanings.sent3: The proselyting event turned into a lively debate.
meanings.sent4: The proselyting efforts were like planting seeds of change.
meanings.sent5: The proselyting campaign reached every corner of the city.
